thread.title: US economy is decelerating, but demand still healthy
thread.title_full: US economy is decelerating, but demand still healthy

author: NEOnline/GK
title: US economy is decelerating, but demand still healthy
text:
It seems as if the days of foreclosure are behind, but the US economy is not as yet out of the woods.
On Tuesday, the US Department of Commerce released data on house construction for September, which confirmed a projection of a rise activity, as opposed to the last three months.
Although residential construction accounts for less than 3% of the US GDP, construction is a significant indicator of demand and underpins the discussion on whether interest rates should rise or not. Indeed, U.S. construction surpassed projections, reflecting a soaring demand for rental apartments. As millennials cannot afford their own house and are more indebted, which makes buying a difficult option, demand for rented apartments also tends to reflect more directly the state of the labour market.
Construction, of course, is one of the sectors that is not suffering from a strong dollar and a decelerating global economy as much. However, overall, 3 rd quarter growth projections in the US indicate that the economy is on a very serious break. Analysts project a 1,5% surge in GDP growth, against a 3,9% in the second quarter.
